intro: Corydalis asterostigma, commonly known as the star-stemd poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, delicate flowers with petals that range from pale pink to white. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Corydalis asterostigma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also studied for its potential medicinal properties.
